data.title: Top Movies and TV Shows
data.meta_description: The best movies and TV shows from Scott Glenn's filmography. Learn what television and films they've been in, sorted by overall online popularity on Television Stats.
data.text:
The Daily Show

as Self • 2 episode s • # 77 most popular show

The Daily Show is an American late-night program that combines comedy with satire to dissect current events, politics, and media. Known for its humorous take on the news, the show features a team of correspondents who contribute to segments and interviews.

Monk

as Sheriff Rollins • 2 episode s • # 192 most popular show

Monk is an American comedy-drama television series that aired on the USA Network. The show follows Adrian Monk, a brilliant detective with obsessive-compulsive disorder and a multitude of phobias. Despite his struggles with his mental health, Monk uses his remarkable attention to detail and highly observant nature to solve crimes. With the help of his assistant, Sharona, and later Natalie, Adrian Monk navigates the ups and downs of both his personal and professional life, all while working to bring justice to the world.

The Leftovers

as Kevin Garvey, Sr. • 14 episode s • # 469 most popular show

The Leftovers is a thought-provoking drama series that explores the aftermath of a global event called the Sudden Departure, where 2% of the world's population mysteriously disappears. Set in the small town of Mapleton, the show follows the lives of the remaining residents as they struggle to cope with their loss and search for meaning in a world turned upside down. With a strong ensemble cast and gripping storytelling, The Leftovers delves into themes of grief, faith, and human connection, leaving viewers captivated and contemplating the mysteries of existence.

The Leftovers

as Kevin Garvey Sr. • 14 episode s • # 469 most popular show

The Leftovers is a thought-provoking drama series that explores the aftermath of a global event called the Sudden Departure, where 2% of the world's population mysteriously disappears. Set in the small town of Mapleton, the show follows the lives of the remaining residents as they struggle to cope with their loss and search for meaning in a world turned upside down. With a strong ensemble cast and gripping storytelling, The Leftovers delves into themes of grief, faith, and human connection, leaving viewers captivated and contemplating the mysteries of existence.

Marvel's Daredevil

as Stick • 5 episode s • # 638 most popular show

Marvel's Daredevil is a thrilling TV show based on the Marvel Comics character, Daredevil. Set in the gritty Hell's Kitchen neighborhood of New York City, the series follows Matt Murdock, a blind lawyer by day and a masked vigilante by night. As Daredevil, he uses his heightened senses and exceptional fighting skills to battle crime and corruption. Filled with intense action sequences, complex characters, and a dark atmosphere, Marvel's Daredevil is a must-watch for fans of the superhero genre.

Castle Rock

as Alan Pangborn • 10 episode s • # 942 most popular show

Castle Rock is a psychological horror series from J.J.Abrams and Stephen King. Set in Castle Rock, Maine, it showcases various themes and characters inspired by King's stories. The series uses its multiverse setup to explore elements of the supernatural in an interconnected, foreboding environment.

American Experience

as Narrator (voice) • 2 episode s • # 1,188 most popular show

American Experience is a television series aired on PBS that explores significant events and personalities in American history through detailed documentaries. Each episode seeks to present an in-depth look at the influences and developments that have shaped the United States, providing viewers with a comprehensive understanding of the nation's past and its cultural impact.

Marvel's The Defenders

as Stick • 8 episode s • # 1,228 most popular show

Marvel's The Defenders is a Netflix series featuring a team of superheroes. The characters, Daredevil, Jessica Jones, Luke Cage and Iron Fist, join forces to save New York City. The storyline is set in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, carrying the dark tone and street-level action.

The Silence of the Lambs

as Jack Crawford • # 87 most popular movie

The Silence of the Lambs is a 1991 American psychological horror thriller film about a young FBI trainee seeking the advice of a cannibalistic serial killer to catch another murderer.

The Bourne Legacy

as Ezra Kramer • # 310 most popular movie

The Bourne Legacy is a 2012 American action-thriller film directed by Tony Gilroy, and is the fourth installment in the series of films adapted from the Jason Bourne novels. The story follows CIA operative Aaron Cross as he becomes embroiled in high-stakes situations resulting from the actions of Jason Bourne.

The Bourne Ultimatum

as Ezra Kramer • # 404 most popular movie

The Bourne Ultimatum is a 2007 action-thriller film directed by Paul Greengrass, the third installment in the Jason Bourne film series. It follows the story of former CIA assassin Jason Bourne as he seeks to uncover his past and evade the attempts of The Company to eliminate him.

Training Day

as Roger • # 544 most popular movie

Training Day is a 2001 American crime thriller film directed by Antoine Fuqua. The movie follows rookie cop Jake Hoyt as he teams up with the corrupt and manipulative detective Alonzo Harris for a day in gang-infested Los Angeles neighborhoods.

The Virgin Suicides

as Father Moody • # 808 most popular movie

The Virgin Suicides is a 1999 American psychological romantic drama film directed by Sofia Coppola. It is based on the debut novel by Jeffrey Eugenides and follows the lives of five adolescent sisters in 1975 Detroit. The film features an original score by the French electronic band Air and stars James Woods, Kathleen Turner, Kirsten Dunst, A.J. Cook, and Josh Hartnett.

The Hunt for Red October

as Bart Mancuso • # 879 most popular movie

The Hunt for Red October is a 1990 American submarine spy thriller film based on Tom Clancy's novel. It follows CIA analyst Jack Ryan's race against time to prove that a Soviet naval captain is defecting with a technologically advanced submarine.

The Hill

as Red Murff • # 1,137 most popular movie

The Hill is a 1965 British-American war drama film directed by Sidney Lumet. The film takes place during World War II and follows a group of British soldiers imprisoned in a military detention camp located in the North African desert. The gripping storyline focuses on the power dynamics and psychological struggles among the inmates, highlighting themes of loyalty, bravery, and the abuse of authority. With stellar performances and a thought-provoking plot, The Hill remains a classic depiction of human endurance and the complexities of wartime experiences.

Sucker Punch

as Wise Man • # 1,319 most popular movie

Sucker Punch is a 2011 American psychological fantasy action film directed by Zack Snyder. It follows the story of a young woman named Babydoll, who is institutionalized by her abusive stepfather. In the film, she creates an alternative reality as a coping strategy and devises a plan to escape.

The Paperboy

as W.W. Jansen • # 1,417 most popular movie

The Paperboy is a 2012 American crime drama film based on Pete Dexter's 1995 novel. It follows Miami reporter Ward Jansen as he returns to his hometown in Florida to investigate a murder case involving a death row inmate. The film features a star-studded cast including Matthew McConaughey, Zac Efron, Nicole Kidman, David Oyelowo, John Cusack and Macy Gray.

The Right Stuff

as Alan Shepard • # 2,187 most popular movie

The Right Stuff is a 1983 American epic historical drama film depicting the journey of seven pilots striving to become the first American astronauts in the midst of the Space Race.

W.

as Donald Rumsfeld • # 2,497 most popular movie

W. is a 2008 American biographical comedy-drama film based on the life of George W. Bush, directed by Oliver Stone and starring Josh Brolin. The movie explores Bush's life, including his personal struggles, triumphs, and the critical events that led to the decision to invade Iraq.

Freedom Writers

as Steve Gruwell • # 2,589 most popular movie

Freedom Writers is a 2007 American drama film based on the book The Freedom Writers Diary. It follows the story of a teacher, Erin Gruwell, who empowers her at-risk students to strive for academic success and embrace tolerance.

Urban Cowboy

as Wes • # 3,344 most popular movie

Urban Cowboy is a 1980 American romantic Western film that follows the love story of Bud Davis and Sissy set against the backdrop of a honky tonk in Pasadena, Texas.

Secretariat

as Chris Chenery • # 3,527 most popular movie

Secretariat is a 2010 American biographical sports drama film that chronicles the remarkable story of Penny Chenery, who against all odds, takes over her father's horse stable and goes on to produce the first Triple Crown winner in 25 years.

Nights in Rodanthe

as Robert Torrelson • # 4,283 most popular movie

Nights in Rodanthe is a 2008 American romantic drama film based on Nicholas Sparks' novel. The story revolves around Adrienne, who is contemplating her troubled marriage, and Paul, a doctor seeking to mend his relationship with his estranged son.

Personal Best

as Terry Tingloff • # 5,199 most popular movie

Personal Best is a 1982 American drama film about the romantic relationship between two track-and-field teammates that evolves into a complex rivalry for a spot on the Olympic team.

Buffalo Soldiers

as Sergeant Lee • # 5,436 most popular movie

Buffalo Soldiers is a 2001 black comedy war film based on the 1993 novel of the same name by Robert O'Connor. It follows a group of American soldiers stationed in West Germany during 1989, just before the fall of the Berlin Wall.

The Shipping News

as Jack Buggit • # 5,626 most popular movie

The Shipping News is a 2001 romantic drama film directed by Lasse Hallström, based on the 1993 novel of the same name by E. Annie Proulx. The story follows a man and his daughter as they move from Upstate New York to a small Newfoundland fishing village to start anew.

Surfer, Dude

as Alister Greenbough • # 6,735 most popular movie

Surfer, Dude is a 2008 American comedy film directed by S.R. Bindler and starring Matthew McConaughey. The story follows surfer Steve Addington as he grapples with an existential crisis during a prolonged lack of waves.

Cattle Annie and Little Britches

as Bill Dalton • # 7,325 most popular movie

Cattle Annie and Little Britches is a 1981 American Western film based on the true story of two adolescent girls in late 19th-century Oklahoma Territory who idolize Western outlaws and attempt to join them.
